questions.q: Which of the following best describes the principle of autonomy in medical ethics?
questions.A: Doing what's best for the patient
questions.B: Respecting patient's right to make decisions
questions.explanation: Patient autonomy refers to the right of patients to make decisions about their medical care without their healthcare provider trying to influence the decision

questions.q: In the context of medical ethics, what is informed consent?
questions.C: Patient understanding and voluntary agreement to treatment
questions.explanation: Informed consent requires that patients understand and voluntarily agree to treatment after being informed of risks, benefits, and alternatives

questions.q: Regarding Oogenesis & ovulation:
questions.A: Primary oocytes are formed after birth until puberty.
questions.B: The 1st meiotic division is arrested in the diplotene stage until just before ovulation.
questions.D: The ova survive for 3 days after ovulation.
questions.E: Ovulation occurs 36 hours after FSH surge.

questions.q: Regarding Fertilization & implantation:
questions.A: Fertilization occurs in the inner third of the fallopian tube.
questions.B: The sperm head penetrates through the corona radiata & zona pellucida while the tail remains outside.
questions.C: The 2nd meiotic division is completed before fertilization.
questions.D: Implantation occurs at the morula stage.
questions.E: The trophoblast invades the endometrium & differentiates into an outer cytotrophoblast & an inner syncytiotrophoblast.

questions.q: The second meiotic division of the oocyte is normally completed:
questions.A: At the stage of the primary follicle.
questions.B: At the stage of the Graafian follicle.
questions.D: In the uterus at the time of implantation.
questions.E: After the sperm penetrates the secondary oocyte.

questions.q: Physiological changes in the reproductive system include:
questions.A: There is no change in the vagina.
questions.B: The uterus first enlarges by hyperplasia then by hypertrophy.
questions.C: There is no change in the cervix.
questions.D: Estrogen has no role in the changes that occur during pregnancy.
questions.E: The lower segment of the uterus will be formed in the 1st trimester.

questions.q: Sure sign of pregnancy is:
If your patient is 8 weeks pregnant, which one of the following USS measurements is most useful:
The following statements are all TRUE about vomiting in pregnancy, EXCEPT:
questions.A: May be cured by admission to hospital
questions.B: Is commonest in the third trimester
questions.E: Is associated with urinary tract infection
questions.explanation: It is more common in the first trimester.

questions.q: First trimester pregnancy may be terminated by:
questions.explanation: Progesterone from the corpus luteum maintains the pregnancy at the early stage before the placenta takes over.

questions.q: The following ultrasonic measurements may be used to confirm or establish gestational age:
questions.explanation: Crown rump length and femur length can be used to determine the gestational age of the fetus.

In normal pregnancy, the value of β-hCG doubles every:
The β-hCG curve in maternal serum in a normal pregnancy peaks at:
The following are considered normal symptoms of pregnancy EXCEPT:
questions.A: Backache due to an increased lumbar lordosis.
questions.B: Lower abdominal pain and groin pain due to stretch of round ligaments.
questions.D: Calf pain due to muscle spasm.

questions.q: A woman in early pregnancy is worried because of several small raised nodules on the areola of both breasts. There are no other findings. Your immediate management should be:
The source of progesterone that maintains the pregnancy during early 1st trimester:
During normal pregnancy, a weight gain anticipated. The average weight gain is approximately:
Counseling of a pregnant patient during early prenatal care should include detection of & information on:
Ultrasound examination used for:
questions.C: Whether abdominal masses are cystic or solid.

questions.q: Which of the following medications, when given before & during pregnancy may help to protect neural tube defects?
questions.explanation: Folic acid and vitamin B12 are given to protect against the development of a neural tube defect.

questions.q: Which of the following is/are needed by women in increased amount during pregnancy?
Often, an increase in vaginal discharge may be noted during pregnancy. It may be:
The following measures are usually performed during a routine antenatal visit for a healthy uncomplicated pregnancy at 36 weeks gestation, EXCEPT:
questions.D: Mid-stream urine specimen (MSU) for culture & sensitivity.

questions.q: Which of the following is NOT a presumptive symptom/sign of pregnancy:
questions.E: Darkening of the skin on the palms of the hands.

The softening of the cervical isthmus that occurs early in gestation is called:
